    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    AGVideoDecoder
    Deprecated.
    Allocator
    An Allocator allocates Allocator.Memory in Vulkan using Allocator.MemoryAllocationInfo.
    Allocator_Vma_Impl
    Allocator Implementation using Vulkan-Memory-Allocator.
    Allocator_Vma_Impl.MemoryAllocationInfoImpl
    Allocator.MemoryAllocationInfo Implementation using Vulkan-Memory-Allocator.
    Allocator_Vma_Impl.MemoryImpl
    Allocator.Memory Implementation using Vulkan-Memory-Allocator.
    Allocator.Memory
    Memory describes some reserved Memory-Region in Vulkan.
    Generally, Memory allocated by an Allocator has to be also freed by the same Allocator.
    Allocator.MemoryAllocationInfo
    Provides information about the memory requirements, etc..
    Implementation dependent.
    Buffer
    Buffers represent linear arrays of data which are used for various purposes by binding them to a graphics or compute pipeline via descriptor sets or certain commands, or by directly specifying them as parameters to certain commands.
    ComputePipeline
    Compute pipelines consist of a single static compute ShaderStage and the PipelineLayout.
    Descriptor
    Descriptors specify, where and what kind of data is accessible in shaders, without actually needing to specify the buffers/images that will be sampled.
    DescriptorData
    Describes how and what data (like Uniforms or Textures) are passed to the shader.
    DescriptorData.ddBuffer
    DescriptorData that describes a Buffer.
    DescriptorData.ddImage
    DescriptorData that describes a Buffer.
    DescriptorPool
    A Descriptor Pool holds some amount of Descriptors.
    DescriptorPool.descriptorPoolSize
    Helper record
    DescriptorPool.DescriptorSet
    Can be freed when either reseting or freeing the pool this was created from
    DescriptorSetLayout
    A descriptor set layout object is defined by an array of zero or more descriptor bindings.
    Framebuffer
    Render passes operate in conjunction with framebuffers.
    GraphicsPipeline
    Graphics pipelines consist of multiple ShaderStages, multiple fixed-function pipeline stages (by default all included), and a PipelineLayout.
    GraphicsPipeline.GraphicsPipelineInfo
    Holds information about the Graphics pipeline.
    GraphicsPipeline.GraphicsPipelineInfo.Scissor
    A representation of a scissor.
    GraphicsPipeline.GraphicsPipelineInfo.Viewport
    A representation of a viewport.
    Image
    Images represent multidimensional - up to 3 - arrays of data which can be used for various purposes (e.g. attachments, textures), by binding them to a graphics or compute pipeline via descriptor sets, or by directly specifying them as parameters to certain commands.
    LanguageCodes
    Deprecated.
    MP4Decoder
    Deprecated.
    MP4Decoder.Box
     
    MP4Structure
    Deprecated.
    MP4Structure.ftyp
     
    MP4Structure.mdat
     
    MP4Structure.mdia
     
    MP4Structure.moov
     
    MP4Structure.mvhd
     
    MP4Structure.tkhd
     
    MP4Structure.trak
     
    MP4Structure.udta
     
    MP4Structure.uuid
     
    Pipeline
    Pipelines are the way of doing work on the GPU, either by a GraphicsPipeline, a RayTracePipeline, or a ComputePipeline.
    PipelineLayout
    A PipelineLayout configures what DescriptorSetLayouts and push-constants are used.
    RayTracePipeline
    Ray tracing pipelines consist of multiple ShaderStages, fixed-function traversal stages, and a PipelineLayout.
    RenderPass
    Draw commands must be recorded within a render pass instance.
    RenderPass.renderAttachment
    An attachment description describes the properties of an attachment including its format, sample count, and how its contents are treated at the beginning and end of each render pass instance.
    RenderPass.subpass
    A subpass represents a phase of rendering that reads and writes a subset of the attachments in a render pass.
    RenderPass.subpass.Reference
    A Reference referencing an attachment index, and a layout.
    Sampler
    VkSampler objects represent the state of an image sampler which is used by the implementation to read image data and apply filtering and other transformations for the shader.
    ShaderCompiler
    A ShaderCompiler compiles some source string (language Implementation dependent) to spir-V.
    ShaderCompiler_Shaderc_Impl
    Shaderc implementation of ShaderCompiler
    ShaderModule
    Shader modules contain shader code and one or more entry points.
    ShaderStage
    A shader specifies programmable operations that execute for each vertex, control point, tessellated vertex, primitive, fragment, or workgroup in the corresponding stage(s) of the graphics and compute pipelines.
    VertexAttribDescriptor
    A VertexDescriptor describes the data of the vertex inside one buffer, as in "this part of the buffer is that vertexes data, etc..".
    A VertexAttribDescriptor then describes how this data is split and how its accessed in shaders.
    An example can be viewed at VertexDescriptor.
    VertexDescriptor
    A VertexDescriptor describes the data of the vertex inside one buffer, as in "this part of the buffer is that vertexes data, etc..".
    A VertexAttribDescriptor then describes how this data is split and how its accessed in shaders.
    Example:

    A buffer is filled with elements, each 3xfloats (position) + 2xfloats (UV-coordinates)
    1.3|2.0|5.3|0|0|4.2|2.0|4.3|1|0|1.6|0.0|2.3|1|1|3.3|1.5|3.8|0|1| a
    A float is 4 bytes, so one element is 4*5 (20) bytes in size!
    VulkanBufferUtils
    VulkanBufferUtils provides nice functions to interact with Buffers
    VulkanDebugUtil
    Utilities for debugging Vulkan
    VulkanFreeable
    An object holding back some kind of resources from Vulkan
    VulkanInstance
    There is no global state in Vulkan and all per-application state is stored in a VkInstance object.
    VulkanInstance.Device
    A representation of a device, eg. your graphics card or some integrated graphics of your CPU
    VulkanInstance.MemoryProperties
    Properties of a VulkanInstance.Devices memory.
    VulkanInstance.QueueFamily
    A QueueFamily, of which Queues can be created.
    VulkanInstance.ValidationLayer
    A representation of a validation-layer
    VulkanInstance.VirtualDevice
    A virtual device is create of a (physical-)VulkanInstance.Device and specifies furthermore what you want to do.
    VulkanObject
    Represents an object in Vulkan, having an address and a device the object resides on.
    VulkanTools
    Class for creating Vulkan Objects and doing stuff with them.
